label: 元嘉暦
対訳語: A Chinese calendar, called the Yüan-chia-li.
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Made in A.D. 443, brought to Japan in 602, adopted officially by the government in 690, being used along with the Gihō-reki. Ceased to be used in 765. It is probable that the Genka-reki was adopted by the government at least unofficially, if not officially, as early as 604. [儀鳳歴]
